title: Camshaft Drive Chain - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Seat, Battery and Fuel Tank Removal T*1
Camshaft Drive Chain Rear Tensioner Rail - Removal
Make sure that Top Dead Centre (TDC) is still set and the crankshaft locking tool is installed.
Never use a 'dot punch' to mark the camshaft drive chain, camshaft or camshaft driven gears. Severe engine damage will result if impact is applied to machined parts.
Use a suitable marker pen to permanently mark one of the outer plates of the camshaft drive chain before removal.
This will make sure the camshaft drive chain is fitted in the same orientation as before removal.
Remove the nut that attaches the primary gear to the crankshaft.
The nut has a right hand thread.
Remove the washer and the primary gear.
Remove the camshaft drive chain from the crankshaft sprocket then remove the chain from the engine.
